Comments_List:
In terms of practical skills, I learned a lot in terms of working with a manuscript and struggling with issues of translation (especially when the text itself is also a translation). 
In terms of knowledge I was able to learn a lot about Evagrius' worldview and his hermeneutic methods for interpreting scripturesscriptures, which directly related to my particular research interests.

The course was very successful. Reading through the manuscript and discussing the exegetical techniques of Evagrius but also thinking about issues of translation, the transmission of ideas, producing critical editions, and learning how to work with a manuscript were especially meaningful.
It was a good chance to engage with Christian Arabic manuscripts
Would definitely recommend to anyone interested in Christian Arabic texts and monastic ideas/theology in particular.
